html:
"The Iquitos International Book Fair will be an opportunity to view Iquitos as the cultural and tourist capital of the Amazon," said Governor Elisban Ochoa, at the FILI - 2022 launch ceremony.

This cultural activity will bring together great storytellers, poets, literary critics, both from our region and from the capital and internationally.

At the ceremony, the deputy manager of Cultural Promotion, Armando Almeida, and the organization's coordinator, Javier D?vila, explained the details of the extensive program to be held from May 15 to 22, in the Jos? Abelardo Qui?onez square in the San Juan Bautista district.

Likewise, they announced the formation of an organizing committee led by GOREL and made up of institutions such as the Scientific University of Peru; DREL ? Regional Educational Project; Javier Heraud Civil Association; College of Journalists of Loreto; Association on Wheels; Amazon Research Institute; Decentralized Directorate of Culture; National University of the Peruvian Amazon and the National Association of Peru.

Professor Nilo Zambrano Pe?a, winner of the essay contest in the First Cultural Artistic Call, congratulated the initiative of the regional management to invest in these activities and requested that these calls be maintained and further expanded in the Loreto region.

Iquitos, as our majestic jungle is close to becoming the cultural and tourist capital of the world, as mentioned by the highest regional authority, who at the time was supported by the public present, highlighting the great opportunity for Iquitos and the entire region, be central protagonists of universal culture.

FILI 2022, in homage to the Loreto writer Gabel Sotil, will be a vital meeting place between creators and their readers, with more than 48 book presentations, 36 poetry recitals, 15 tributes to Amazonian writers, 30 workshops, 18 round tables , 18 conferences and talks, 6 film screenings, 18 storytelling, 8 artistic-cultural shows.
